dt: {bc}a meeting together of people for the purpose of trade by private purchase and sale and usually not by auction
{bc}the people assembled at such a meeting
{bc}a public place where a market is held
{bc}a place where provisions are sold at wholesale
{bc}a retail establishment usually of a specified kind
{bc}the act or an instance of buying and selling
{bc}the rate or price offered for a {d_link|commodity|commodity} or security
{bc}a geographic area of demand for {d_link|commodities|commodity} or services
{bc}the course of commercial activity by which the exchange of {d_link|commodities|commodity} is effected {bc}extent of demand
{bc}the available supply of or potential demand for specified goods or services
{bc}the area of economic activity in which buyers and sellers come together and the forces of supply and demand affect prices

dt.t: producing goods for {wi}market{/wi} rather than for consumption

dt: {bc}in the position of being a potential buyer

et: Middle English, probably from Continental Germanic; akin to Old Saxon {it}markat{/it} marketplace, Old High German {it}marcāt{/it}, both ultimately from Latin {it}mercatus{/it} trade, marketplace, from {it}mercari{/it} to trade, from {it}merc-, merx{/it} merchandise
shortdef: a meeting together of people for the purpose of trade by private purchase and sale and usually not by auction
the people assembled at such a meeting
a public place where a market is held; especially : a place where provisions are sold at wholesale

dt: {bc}to expose for sale in a market

shortdef: to expose for sale in a market

dt: {bc}a variety of consumer goods and services used to calculate a consumer price index

shortdef: a variety of consumer goods and services used to calculate a consumer price index

dt: {bc}an economy in which most goods and services are produced and distributed through free markets

shortdef: an economy in which most goods and services are produced and distributed through free markets

dt: {bc}an intermediary in a stock exchange who controls buy and sell orders (as by purchase and resale) for a particular stock or group of stocks

shortdef: an intermediary in a stock exchange who controls buy and sell orders (as by purchase and resale) for a particular stock or group of stocks

dt: {bc}an order to buy or sell securities or commodities immediately at the best price obtainable in the market

shortdef: an order to buy or sell securities or commodities immediately at the best price obtainable in the market

dt: {bc}a price actually given in current market dealings

shortdef: a price actually given in current market dealings
